result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Rec'd copy of INFO/waived reading. Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial.  Bond continues.  Atty. Masana got a plea/sentencing date.

11:17 AM Defendant Sloane M. Fleischer in court.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Sloane M. Fleischer.  Attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for State of Wisconsin. Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 3.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:48 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess and Intern, Dan Moon, in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sloane M. Fleischer in court.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Sloane M. Fleischer.  Atty Masana requests a preliminary hearing.  Matter reset.  Bond continues.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

3:11 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess and Intern, Dan Moon, in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sloane M. Fleischer appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes in court for Sloane M. Fleischer.  Atty Hayes explains missed court appearance due to transportation issues.  State requests $150 cash bond with same previous conditions.  Atty Hayes recommends signature be reinstated.  Court reinstates previous bond.
Return date scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on July 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:49 PM Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sloane M. Fleischer not in court.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Sloane M. Fleischer.  Atty Masana states he exchanged emails w/DE recently and was hoping she would be here.  He's had no contact w/her.  State requests warrant.Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.
Return date on May 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

03:13 PM Defendant Sloane M. Fleischer in court with attorney Annie E Getsinger.  Defendant Sloane M. Fleischer in custody.  Natalia J Gess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sloane M. Fleischer appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  DE does qualify for PD appt.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  State requests signature bond with conditions.  Atty Getsinger doesn't object.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $500.00 signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety and no possession of any controlled substances w/o valid prescription.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
